page.title: 15Holtsmere End Junior School
page.content: Our school has been open just under ten years. It used to be a J.M.I. School but there got to be too many children so they built an{Infants' {School}next to it. In 1979 the school had over 300 pupils and will grow as big again.{The Survey Block includes {the Junior School but not the Infants. --There are about{140 children}in the school in 6 classes (although there is room for 8 classes in four 2-class units). The four Lower Junior(7-9 year old) classes are quite small and the two Upper Junior classes are bigger but each have their own unit. --Almost all the children live on {Woodhall Farm}and walk to school, though some parents bring their children in cars and park outside the school gates. This makes it very dangerous to cross Shenley Road, so we have a{School Crossing Patrol.
